input_output.uvtable_filename: UVTable with data to be fit. An ASCII file should have columns of: u [\lambda], v [\lambda], Re(V) [Jy], Im(V) [Jy], weights [Jy^-2]. An npz file should have columns of: u [\lambda], v [\lambda], V [Jy; complex: real + imag * 1j], weights [Jy^-2])
input_output.save_dir: Directory in which output datafiles and figures are saved
input_output.save_profile_fit: Whether to save fitted brightness profile
input_output.save_vis_fit: Whether to save fitted visibility distribution
input_output.save_uvtables: Whether to save fitted and residual UV tables (these are reprojected)
input_output.iteration_diag: Whether to return and save diagnostics of the fit iteration (needed for diag_plot)
input_output.format: Output file format. Default is the same as for 'uvtable_filename', else choose from 'npz' or 'txt'

modify_data.baseline_range: (Deprojected) baseline range outside of which visibilities are truncated, unit=[\lambda]
modify_data.correct_weights: Whether to estimate the data's weights (as they may be unknown for mock data)
modify_data.use_median_weight: Whether to estimate all weights as the median binned visibility variance (or instead estimate weights using the baseline-dependent variance)
modify_data.norm_wle: Wavelength (unit=[m]) by which to normalize the (u, v) points (i.e., convert from [m] to [rad]). Not needed if the (u, v) points are already in units of [\lambda]

geometry.type: How the geometry is determined: 'known' if user-supplied, 'gaussian' to fit it with a gaussian, 'nonparametric' to fit it nonparametrically
geometry.fit_phase_offset: Whether to fit for the phase center
geometry.fit_inc_pa: Whether to fit for the inclination and position angle
geometry.initial_guess: Whether to use the below values of `inc`, `pa`, `dra`, and `ddec` as an initial guess for the geometry (if `fit_phase_offset` is True or `fit_inc_pa` is True, the respective values below will be used. Guess is only used if `type` is 'gaussian' or 'nonparametric')
geometry.pa: Position angle, defined east of north, unit=[deg]
geometry.dra: Delta (offset from 0) right ascension, defined positive for offsets toward east, unit=[arcsec]
geometry.rescale_flux: Whether to rescale the total flux to account for the source's inclination (see frank.geometry.rescale_total_flux)

hyperparameters.n: Number of collocation points used in the fit (suggested range 100 - 300)
hyperparameters.rout: Maximum disc radius in the fit (best to overestimate size of source), unit=[arcsec]
hyperparameters.alpha: Order parameter for the power spectrum's inverse Gamma prior (suggested range 1.00 - 1.50). If a list, multiple fits will be performed and overplotted.
hyperparameters.p0: Scale parameter for the power spectrum's inverse Gamma prior (suggested >0, <<1). If 'null', the code will internally choose a sensible value.
hyperparameters.wsmooth: Strength of smoothing applied to the power spectrum (suggested range 10^-4 - 10^-1). If a list, multiple fits will be performed and overplotted.
hyperparameters.iter_tol: Tolerance for fit iteration stopping criterion (suggested <<1)
hyperparameters.converge_failure: How to treat the case when the fit does not reach convergence by 'max_iter': one of ['raise', 'warn', 'ignore'] to respectively raise an error, raise a warning, or ignore.
hyperparameters.nonnegative: Whether the best-fit nonnegative brightness profile is included in the frank fit solution object
hyperparameters.method: The fit method: 'Normal' to fit in linear brighness, 'LogNormal' to fit in logarithmic brightness

plotting.quick_plot: Whether to make a figure showing the simplest plots of the fit
plotting.full_plot: Whether to make a figure more fully showing the fit and its diagnostics
plotting.diag_plot: Whether to make a diagnostic figure showing fit convergence metrics
plotting.deprojec_plot: Whether to make a figure showing the effect of deprojection on the (u, v) points and visibilities
plotting.distance: Distance to source, optionally used for plotting, unit=[pc]
plotting.force_style: Whether to use preconfigured matplotlib rcParams in generated figures
plotting.bin_widths: Bin widths in which to bin the observed visibilities, list of float or int, unit=[\lambda]
plotting.stretch: Type of stretch to apply to swept profile image colormaps, either 'power' or 'asinh'
plotting.gamma: Index of power law normalization to apply to swept profile image colormaps (1.0 = linear scaling)
plotting.asinh_a: Scale parameter for an arcsinh normalization to apply to swept profile image colormaps
plotting.iter_plot_range: Range of iterations to be plotted in the diagnostic figure, list of int of the form [start, stop]
plotting.plot_in_logx: Whether to plot visibility distributions in log(baseline) in 'quick_plot' and 'full_plot'
plotting.norm_residuals: Whether to normalize plotted visibility residuals in 'full_plot'

analysis.compare_profile: Path of file with comparison profile to be overplotted with frank fit (.txt or .dat). Columns: r [arcsec], I [Jy / sr], optional 3rd column with a single error [Jy / sr] or optional 3rd and 4th columns with lower and upper errors
analysis.clean_beam: Dictionary of B_major [arcsec], B_minor [arcsec], position angle [deg] of beam to convolve frank profile
analysis.bootstrap_ntrials: Number of trials (dataset realizations) to perform in a bootstrap analysis
